item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- they’ll go through anything. You read and you’re pierced." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty...But I am too busy thinking about myself." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "It is remarkable, Hardin, how the religion of science has grabbed hold. " -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Seek freedom and become captive of your desires. Seek discipline and find your liberty." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "Books, Cats, Life is Good." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jlawrence add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain
